children.name: Unit testing - Checks a module (or class or component) is working as expected or not
Integration testing - Checks a group of modules (or classes or components) is working as expected or not
System testing - Checks all functional requirements or not
Acceptance testing - Checks all business requirements or not
Smoke testing - Checks the most critical functionality is working or not
Regression testing - Checks the new changes are breaking any existing functionality or not
Performance testing - Checks the system under expected load is performing as expected or not
Load testing - Checks the system under expected load is performing as expected or not
Stress testing - Checks the system under unexpected load is performing as expected or not
Breakpoint testing - Finds recoverable, unrecoverable and catastrophic points of load by ramping up the load
Chaos testing - Checks the system is working as expected or not under unexpected conditions
Usability testing - Checks the system is user friendly or not
Security testing - Checks the system is secure or not
Compatibility testing - Checks the system is compatible with other systems or not
Alpha testing - Checks the system is working as expected or not by the developers
Beta testing - Checks the system is working as expected or not by the end users
A/B testing - Checks the system by splitting load or live traffic into two or more behaviours and comparing the results and user reactions
Sanity testing - Automatically testing the critical system is working as expected or not after a change
Shadow testing - Automatically testing if the new state i.e code, configuration or change is working as expected or not by comparing with responses in old state
Accessibility testing - Checks the system can be used by all kinds of users or not
